author: m.kalinin
content: A proposal to replace `-32002: Invalid terminal block` error with  `INVALID_TERMINAL_BLOCK` status, https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/pull/170

author: sauliusgrigaitis
content:
Just a note on my question during the call - the scenario I was talking about:

1) CL gets block from gossip let's say at +1s (0s is the start of the slot);
2) CL insterts this payload into EL and gets no answer is it valid or not (say, gets SYNCING); <- the problem here is that it's not well defined (it's tricky to define it) and left to EL teams to decided how exactly to behave when deciding to delay the response a bit in order to get the VALID/INVALID response or just return SYNCING.
3) CL hopes that EL will validate the payload until +4s. So CL is left to only poll the EL until +4s.

We can maybe live with that polling (how often?), but all the CL implementations should at least poll EL once just before attesting in hope that the payload is actually validated at +4s.

author: pietjepuk
content: Can insertPayload return `SYNCING`? I thought the point was that it just does some sanity checks, not actually sync.
